sen.j: 武生騒動（たけふそうどう）とは、福井県越前市で明治維新後の明治3年に発生した暴動。
sen.e: Takefu riot was a rebellion that occurred in Echizen City, Fukui Prefecture in 1870 after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 当時、越前市（旧武生市に相当）を治めていた本多家は、越前福井藩の陪臣として幕府から大名格の処遇を得てきたが、明治政府が制定した華族制度では、当主の本多副元が華族でなく士族とされた。
sen.e: At that time, the Honda family, the ruler of Echizen City (the area previously known as Fusho City), had been treated as if they were a treatment of a Daimyo by the Bakufu (Shogunate) when the Honda family were actually baishin (indirect vassals) of the Echizen-fukui Domain, but in the peerage system established by the Meiji Government, the lord Sukemoto HONDA was ranked as a Shizoku (warrior class) not Kazoku (the peerage).
sen.cmt: この説明だけでは英語圏の人には分かりにくいかと思います。「華族制度では大名は華族とされたが、本田副元は大名並の扱いを受けていたにもかかわらずその下の士族とされた」などの説明を補った方がいいかと思われます。
sen.e: At that time, Bakufu (Shogunate) treated the Honda family, the ruler of Echizen City (the area previously known as Fusho City), with the equivalent of a Daimyo treatment as a baishin (indirect vassals) of the Echizen-fukui Domain, however in the peerage system established by the Meiji government, the lord Sukemoto HONDA was ranked as a Shizoku (warrior class) not Kazoku (the peerage).
sen.cmt: "had been treated as if …when the Honda family were actually …"だと、「実際は陪臣であったが大名格の扱いをいけていた」となり、若干ニュアンスが異なるので、書き直しました。

sen.j: このことを不服とした旧家臣や町民が変更を求めて行動を起こし暴動に至った。
sen.e: His old retainers and townspeople were not happy about this and asking for a change, they ended up in a rebellion.
His old retainers and townspeople were not happy about this therefore they demanded for a change and a rebellion had occurred.

sen.j: この騒動で亀山社中や海援隊 (浪士結社)の一員でもあった関義臣も連座により逮捕された。
sen.e: In this rebellion, Yoshiomi SEKI, who was a member of the Kameyama Shachu and Kaientai (both were names of an association of leaderless warriors organized by Ryoma SAKAMOTO), was arrested for his involvement.

sen.e: Sukemoto HONDA was raised to the peerage and he erected a monument in Ryosen-ji temple for the 15 retainers who fought and died in the rebellion.
